page.title: 01Hereford.
page.content: Hereford is a cathedral city with a population of approx. 45,000.It is the centre of a county mainly involved in agriculture.The name "Hereford" means "army ford" Our block consists of 50% farmland, 45% residential with 5% commercial interests. The River Wye, flowing in an easterly direction, bisects the area. It is crossed by four bridges, one obsolete rail(now used as a cycle track),two road (one built circa 1500,one modern built 1967) and one footbridge. A modern ring road follows the line of the old city walls, parts of which are still visible. Buses provide good service to all regions and there is easy access to the Motorway system.
